fullName.value: Exchange factor directly activated by cAMP 1
Exchange protein directly activated by cAMP 1
Rap1 guanine-nucleotide-exchange factor directly activated by cAMP
cAMP-regulated guanine nucleotide exchange factor I

texts.value: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) for RAP1A and RAP2A small GTPases that is activated by binding cAMP. Through simultaneous binding of PDE3B to RAPGEF3 and PIK3R6 is assembled in a signaling complex in which it activates the PI3K gamma complex and which is involved in angiogenesis. Plays a role in the modulation of the cAMP-induced dynamic control of endothelial barrier function through a pathway that is independent on Rho-mediated signaling. Required for the actin rearrangement at cell-cell junctions, such as stress fibers and junctional actin
Interacts with PDE3B and PIK3R6; form a signaling complex that regulates phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase gamma in angiogenesis
Widely expressed with highest levels in adult kidney, heart, thyroid and brain, and fetal kidney
The DEP domain is involved in membrane localization independent from regulation by cAMP
It is uncertain whether Met-1 or Met-43 is the initiator

features.description: Diminishes GEF activity dependence on cAMP concentration.
